str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.
